result_list.explanation: Il prélude encore. - This stage direction refers to musical prelude, which fits the category of music.
(Gen. XXII, 17 et 18). - This stage direction seems to be a reference to a biblical passage, which adds narrative quality and is intended for readers.
Le Comte paraît. - This indicates the Count entering the stage, which fits the category of entrance.
Tout accourt à sa voix. - This indicates movement towards someone or something, which fits the category of movement.
Il se lève de table. - This is a general action of standing up from the table, which fits the category of action.
À demi-voix. - This describes the manner of speaking, which fits the category of delivery.
Elles traversent toutes deux. - This indicates movement across the stage, which fits the category of movement.
Elle joint les mains. - This is a general action of joining hands, which fits the category of action.
On frappe à la porte au fond. - This describes an interaction with an object (the door), which fits the category of object.
result_list.stgdir: On frappe à la porte au fond.

result_list.explanation: Paquette lui serrant la main. - This indicates a non-verbal interaction between characters, which fits the category of interaction.
